result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant Christian D Jones in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Court to request adjournment. Filed by Atty. Redetzke.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on May 26, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to set hearing on 6-23-22 at 10:00 a.m.**
Hearing on June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

02:36 PM Defendant Christian D Jones in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no contact with any Planet Fitness.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:36 PM Defendant Christian D Jones in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Atty. Kirk Redetzke.
Initial appearance on April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:29 AM Defendant Christian D Jones in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Redetzke appears as friend of the court and is asking to adjourn the initial appearance to allow for him to be retained on this matter as well.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance for next Friday and note the defendant will not be in Court until closer to 2:30 PM.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on April 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Christian D Jones in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has not yet received the criminal complaints on his new matters but is currently represented by Attorney Kirk Redetzke on his other case.  The Court will adjourn this matter to tomorrow for an initial appearance as the defendant has a preliminary hearing set for tomorrow.  Court orders the defendant to contact the Public Defenders office today so Attorney Redetkze may be appointed to his new cases.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
